text: - My name is Mawuli Denteh,

and I'm a cloud engineer
with ScaleCapacity.

I'm based off in Ho, in
another region within Ghana.

I graduated with a
degree in marine science

and it was a bit tough,
honestly, to get a job.
Then COVID happened.

Because of that, we
were gradually laid off
and there was nothing for me to do.
But then, another door opened.
That was when I was able to discover my,
and follow my passion for tech

by going through training,
initially, in web development
and then came along AWS re/Start.
And so it was very exciting

for me because I had
prior, little experience
and I also saw some other skills
on there that I wanted to add to myself.

AWS re/Start and AWS
certifications have been
so, so crucial in helping me get the job.
I actually landed a job while I was still
on AWS certified cloud practitioner.

Cloud practitioner, for
sure, gave me the basic

and core footing that I
needed and then after that,

I got my AWS Certified
Solutions Architect associate.

That particular one, I
would say, was very key
in pushing my understanding further

and it definitely impacted my
ability to serve my customers.
I remember when I joined my company,

I was really, really
scared of a lot of things,
but I quickly started learning a lot
and I took on additional certifications

and I was able to now
solve more complex problems

and take them on if the
customer had questions

or concerns about things,
I was able to get in there
and then figure out the best way out.
Preparing for AWS certifications exams

and taking up this career
path has really demanded a lot
of commitment from me and time,
which I was gladly putting in.

And it has definitely even
given me a better feeling
about myself and about my abilities.

So I feel more confident
about my learning abilities
and what I can achieve and what I can do.
(bright upbeat music)
